frame.name: FR_Make_agreement_on_assessment
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cognizers</fen> come to a similarity (or dissimilarity) of <fen>Opinion</fen>, generally through communicating about their opinions. The <fen>Cognizers</fen> may be expressed separately, with <fen>Cognizer_2</fen> being the basis for establishing the <fen>Opinion</fen> of <fen>Cognizer_1</fen>. Rather than a specific <fen>Opinion</fen>, a phenomenon about which a similar or differing <fen>Opinion</fen> is held, the <fen>Topic</fen>, may be specified.
<ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : new in fndata-asfalda (created as an inchoative frame for Be_in_agreement_on_assessment, as Make_agreement_on_action is to Be_in_agreement_on_action).
<ex></ex> Distinctions with other frames: <ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>Be_in_agreement_on_assessment</frframe>: FR_Make_agreement_on_assessment is inchoative of Be_in_agreement_on_assessment.
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>Make_agreement_on_action</frframe>: FR_Make_agreement_on_assessment is about Cognizers coming to a similarity of opinions (about some content) whereas Make_agreement_on_action is about Parties agreeing to commit to an Obligation.
<ex><fex name="Cognizers">Dr. Gerry and Mr. Pond</fex> <t>agree</t> <fex name="Topic">in their impressions</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Cognizers">This copyeditor and I</fex> <fex name="Degree">mostly</fex> <t>see</t> <t>eye</t> <t>to</t> <t>eye</t> <fex name="Topic">on things</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Cognizer_1">I</fex> <t>agree</t> <fex name="cog2">with you</fex> <fex name="Opinion">that everything should be monitored to keep the person from wasting time and protecting the interests of the company</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizers
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks constituents that express the set of <fen>Cognizers</fen> whose similarity of opinion is at issue.
</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer_1
FE.definition: <def-root>When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is the individual characterized by their similarity in opinion to <fen>Cognizer_2</fen>, whose opinion is assumed to be known. <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is often an external argument. </def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer_2
FE.definition: <def-root>When the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Cognizer_2</fen> is the one whose opinion is assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing the opinion of <fen>Cognizer_1</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Opinion
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs believed by the <fen>Cognizers</fen>.
<ex>We <t>agree</t> <fex name="opi">that babies should not be dropped from helicopters</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>A phenomenon that the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are considering with respect to their <fen>Opinion</fen>.</def-root>
